title: Alan Shearer lays into Arsene Wenger for dropping Alexis Sanchez against Liverpool
text:
Sport Alan Shearer lays into Arsene Wenger for dropping Alexis Sanchez against Liverpool The Gunners slumped to a 3-1 defeat at Anfield after the Chilean was benched following a series of rows Share Sanchez came on at half-time but couldn't prevent a 3-1 defeat (Photo: Getty) Share Get Arsenal   
Former England captain Alan Shearer says he cannot believe Arsene Wenger's decision to drop Alexis Sanchez for the defeat at Liverpool. 
The Chilean started the Anfield clash on the bench following a series of rows with the Frenchman and came on after half-time with the Arsenal trailing 2-0. 
Sanchez assisted Danny Welbeck's goal but his introduction was not enough to prevent the 3-1 loss which delivered a blow to the Gunners top four hopes. 
And former Newcastle striker has admitted he is struggling to comprehend the decision. 
"I cannot for the life of me understand what Arsene Wenger was doing at Liverpool on Saturday," he wrote in his Sun column. Wenger has come under another wave of scrutiny (Photo: Getty) Sanchez provided an assist for Welbeck (Photo: Reuters) Read More 
"It is one of your biggest games of the season and you leave your best player on the bench. If the Arsenal manager was trying to prove some sort of point to Alexis Sanchez it backfired badly. 
"He ended up giving further ammunition to those who would like to see him leave." 
Shearer also slammed Wenger's decision to hold fire on his decision over a new contract decision, believing that is sending out the wrong message. The banners were out again at Anfield (Photo: Reuters) 
"They appear to be a club that does not know where it is going, what it wants to do. They are in a kind of footballing limbo," Shearer continues. 
"That is not being helped by the manager’s refusal to commit to a new deal . . . making it a bit rich if he has a problem with Sanchez doing the same. Video Loading
